cyclone.name: ZETA
cyclone.current_location: about 255 mi SSE of the western tip of Cuba
cyclone.trajectory: Moving north-northwest, forecast to turn west-northwest toward the Yucatán Channel late Monday, then enter the southern Gulf and lift north toward the central U.S. Gulf Coast (LA-MS-AL) mid-week.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: southeast Louisiana (near the mouth of the Mississippi River)

weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire north-central Gulf Coast from southeast Louisiana eastward to Alabama and the western Florida Panhandle
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (>=34 kt) are a 1-in-5 chance late Wednesday night into Thursday; low (5%) chance of 50 kt gusts.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Early guidance suggests 2–4 ft surge possible along the Alabama coast and within Mobile Bay if the center makes landfall west of the port.
weather_observation.rainfall: Potential 4–6 inches with locally higher amounts Thursday as the core and rain-shield cross Alabama.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Brief tornadoes in outer rainbands, rough seas and long-period swells disrupting vessel movements and cargo operations.
